newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: North Europeans buy more NZ sheepmeat - Meat Board.
newsitem.headline: North Europeans buy more NZ sheepmeat - Meat Board.

text.p: Northern European markets paid an extra NZ$67 million for New Zealand sheepmeat in the 1995-96 season, the New Zealand Meat Producers Board said on Thursday.

"Flourishing demand for our sheepmeat from sophisticated North European markets, which embrace the countries of Italy, Germany, France, the Netherlands, Denmark, Belgium and Luxembourg, has grown from 66,500 tonnes in 1994-95 to 75,000 tonnes in 1995-96. This was worth $442 million in 1995-96, up from $375 million in 1994-95," the board said in a statement.
New Zealand's trade in Northern Europe had changed dramatically over the past eight years.

Exports of carcasses fell from 12 percent of the total trade in 1987 down to 4.0 percent last year, while exports of chilled meat increased from 3.0 percent of exports in 1987 to 9.0 percent last year.

The board said this trend away from the commodity trade had increased the value of exports by 100 percent over the past eight years, while the volume of exports grew by 50 percent over the same period.
